main_definition: Existing or happening at the same time or to a person in common; shared by two or more parties.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Shared or held in common between two or more people, things, or groups
meanings_and_examples.example: The agreement was mutual, meaning both sides benefited from the arrangement.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Existing simultaneously and equally among a group of individuals
meanings_and_examples.example: Mutual respect is essential in any successful relationship; each person values what the other brings to the table.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Involving two or more parties who share a common interest, goal, or benefit
meanings_and_examples.example: Their business partnership was based on mutual interests and goals, leading to great success for both companies.
